Description: Papyrus written with black ink, demotic legal document with sale and receipt (prasis) of a share of a vineyard and appurtenances by the woman Ho-ankh to Protarchus called Chesthotes. Reign of Ptolemy Philopator: "year lost, but from the priests' names it can be fixed as the 10th year and the month is Payni" (Thompson's MS Catalogue). 6 lines of writing on recto, names of 16 witnesses on verso.
Curator's comments: Published C.Andrews in Fs. Edwards. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2720) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2720)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, fractured, loss Black ink Backed: brown paper Supported overall: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
